message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DM, cs.ST, cs.SI

The paper discusses clustering and segmentation, which are common topics in machine learning and data mining. The use of infinite mixture models suggests a focus on unsupervised learning, which is often categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also introduces a novel algorithm for summarizing and visualizing information, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). The use of entropy as a measure of segmentation suggests a connection to information theory, which could place the paper under cs.DM (Data Mining) or cs.ST (Statistics).
